Articles.Content:
Let me start off by saying awesome game and way to go on the updates. 1.1 looks great with the increases to jets and optimizations.

However going forward we can only currently use all those great jet parts on 2 of 14 visitable bodies (Laythe and Kerbin) and while both are a lot of fun Laythe is mostly water.

So after the optimization to 64 I'm thinking 1.2 is a perfect time for gas planet 2 which I thought no should include 2 atmospheric bodies.

For me for planets I would love to see.

1. A nice giant Jupiter analog with a swirled surface and a moving giant storm

2. A slightly bigger than Gilly sized planet grazer. Basically a planet that is super close to GP2 with an orbit just above the atmosphere of GP2 and a orbit under 1 day. Make it tidally locked.

3. A jet breathing atmosphere planet with an extremely elliptical orbit coming quite close in to GP2 at its perapsis but have a very far apoasis. Basically this planet will be the elevator of the GP2 orbit allowing somebody to jump on close to GP2 and then get off much farther out to catch another moon with little DV cost.

4. An additional jet breathing planet Val sized mid way out. This being an extremely rough planet with mountains / ridges extending above the atmosphere in spots so that landings can be done in vacuum or a skilled pilot can risk airbraking with the constant threat of lithobraking if you plot the wrong course. Also flying a jet around this world would be very interesting as a skilled jet could leap out of the atmosphere to "hopefully" clear some of the mountains ridges).

5. A rock garden of 6-8 Gilly sized planets in close orbit (couple of km apart) but somewhat different representing a planet that recently broke up. Threading a encounter through there would be a true test to get to the middle.

6. One planet a fair ways out that is orbiting backwards that is elongated around its equator such that it's rotation is only slightly less than orbit speed at the equator making it much easier to land at the poles instead of the equator.

7. Leave Eeloo by itself.

My humble dream moon combination.

Well KSP currently has four terrestrial worlds with atmospheres that can support flight (Eve, Kerbin, Duna, and Laythe). Our own solar system also has four such worlds (Venus, Earth, Mars, and Titan). So I think KSP isn't going too badly.

What's missing is good propulsion for those without oxygen in their atmospheres. 1.0 sent ion gliders extinct and penalised rocket planes too. Many players, myself included, want to see an electric propeller to fill the gap. For the time being there's the KAX mod.

Yeah, new planets are long overdue and now with the switch to 64 bit (to be unable to use it you have to have Windows XP 32 bit which should be rare/nonexistent) we should be easily able to afford them.

Some interesting planets would really renew my interest in KSP.

Incase you're not aware, there are mods that add planets and moons using Kopernicus.

There's about 5 or so that I'm aware of, most add a gas planet and some moons. One, Asclepius, adds a planet with a thin oxygen atmosphere between Kerbin and Duna.

Maybe try searching the different planet packs and see if you like any of them.

Remember, the stock game still needs to run as 32-bit because it was sold as running on 32 bit machines. Maybe U5 will improve memory usage and allow for a new world or two, but the reintroduction of 64 bit doesn't absolve Squad of having to remain compatible with advertised system requirements.

I think they should add a nuclear ramjet or turbojet to solve the exoatmospheric flight problem. It would be simple, easy to implement, and provide the player with something more to lug around to other planets.

Definitely. Since a modder was capable of doing it just fine, why can't Squad? Why have SLS parts loaded in memory when I'm flying a plane? Or planet textures loaded when in VAB?

I've been shaking my head at this for at least 2 years.

I think they should add a nuclear ramjet or turbojet to solve the exoatmospheric flight problem. It would be simple, easy to implement, and provide the player with something more to lug around to other planets.

Porkjets Atomic Age mod adds exactly that, along with some other very nice nuclear engines.

It's even better than that: it's a planet that is both airless and with an oxygen atmosphere, thanks to the air-filled canyons. That's the kind of unique feature with unique gameplay consequences that would make it an interesting addition to stock.

SO I've heard, I have it installed (along with Outer Planets) but haven't had the chance to go to either of them.

For those worried about RAM usage, I only have 4GB and run quite a lot of parts mods and it runs fine for me. If you added all the planet packs you could find, that might be a different story!

A list of all the planet packs made with Kopernicus can be found here.
